Data.ProgrammeTitle: Bournemouth and Poole (University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust) 2 year Foundation Programme 01
Data.ProgrammeDescription: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust was formed in April 2022 following the merger of Poole General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust and The Royal Bournemouth and Christchurch Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust.  It is expected that all medical training programmes, including foundation, will work across the three sites as services are being reconfigured  **All FP 2025 programmes are subject to change in relation to placement order, specialty, length, site and Trust.** Foundation doctor must hold a current and in date valid driving licence or arrange alternative means of transport to travel to all locations where the placement is based in order to fulfil the requirements of the placement.

Data.EmployerTrust: UNIVERSITY HOSPITALS OF LEICESTER NHS TRUST
Data.Specialties: Acute Internal Medicine, General (Internal) Medicine, General Surgery, Plastic Surgery, Trauma and Orthopaedic Surgery
Data.ProgrammeDescription: This programme offers opportunity to gain experience in medical education and in the F2 year one of the 4 month posts offers and innovative split between the Clinical Education Department and General Practice.  The Clinical Education post will offer opportunity to deliver teaching to medical students, undertake QI projects and become involved in development of innovative teaching methods, with access to a digital learning technologist.  With both F1 and F2 based in Leicester the programme offers geographical stability. All programmes are subject to change in relation to placement order, specialty, length, banding, site and Trust. Programme Information and Job Descriptions is available here: https://www.eastmidlandsdeanery.nhs.uk/recruitment/foundation/lnr_job_descriptions_programmes

With both F1 and F2 based in Leicester the programme offers geographical stability. All programmes are subject to change in relation to placement order, specialty, length, banding, site and Trust. Programme Information and Job Descriptions is available here: https://www.eastmidlandsdeanery.nhs.uk/recruitment/foundation/lnr_job_descriptions_programmes

Data.EmployerTrust: NORTHAMPTON GENERAL HOSPITAL NHS TRUST
Data.Specialties: Acute Internal Medicine, Clinical Oncology, General Surgery, Otolaryngology, Palliative Medicine, Respiratory Medicine
Data.ProgrammeDescription: This programme offers opportunity to gain experience in medical education and in the F2 year one of the 4 month posts offers and innovative split between the Clinical Education Department and General Practice.  The Clinical Education post will offer opportunity to deliver teaching to medical students, undertake QI projects and become involved in development of innovative teaching methods, with access to a digital learning technologist.  With both F1 and F2 based in Leicester the programme offers geographical stability. All programmes are subject to change in relation to placement order, specialty, length, banding, site and Trust. Programme Information and Job Descriptions is available here: https://www.eastmidlandsdeanery.nhs.uk/recruitment/foundation/lnr_job_descriptions_programmes

Data.Specialties: General Practice, General Surgery, Geriatric Medicine, Haematology, Intensive Care Medicine, Obstetrics and Gynaecology
Data.ProgrammeDescription: Foundation Priority Programme. This programme offers pathology experience and education to foundation doctors alongside their two-year foundation training. This will involve longitudinally integrated pathology experience, an F1 pathology taster and F2 training block.  **All FPP 2025 programmes are subject to change in relation to placement order, specialty, length, site and Trust.** Foundation doctor must hold a current and in date valid driving licence or arrange alternative means of transport to travel to all locations where the placement is based in order to fulfil the requirements of the placement.

Data.EmployerTrust: NHS TAYSIDE
Data.Specialties: Cardiology, Obstetrics and Gynaecology, Trauma and Orthopaedic Surgery
Data.ProgrammeDescription: All placements are based within Tayside area.  This is a 2 year programme. F2 rotation will be determined in advance of your F2 year there is no external competitive process for allocation to F2 please see regional page on the SCOTMT website for details: http://www.scotmt.scot.nhs.uk/foundation/foundation-programmes/.aspx  where you will also find information of Foundation training in Scotland.  Once allocated to the Scottish Foundation School programme there is no system for swaps between individual programmes.  Swaps will not be facilitated under any circumstances.  This programme is indicative and a generic Foundation Programme designed to deliver all the Foundation competencies.  All programmes are subject to change in relation to placements order, location, speciality, length  etc    The SCOTMT website for details on Foundation training in Scotland: http://www.scotmt.scot.nhs.uk/foundation/foundation-programmes/.aspx

Data.ProgrammeDescription: All placements are based within Tayside area.  This is a 2 year programme. F2 rotation will be determined in advance of your F2 year there is no external competitive process for allocation to F2 please see regional page on the SCOTMT website for details: http://www.scotmt.scot.nhs.uk/foundation/foundation-programmes/.aspx  where you will also find information of Foundation training in Scotland.  Once allocated to the Scottish Foundation School programme there is no system for swaps between individual programmes.  Swaps will not be facilitated under any circumstances.  This programme is indicative and a generic Foundation Programme designed to deliver all the Foundation competencies.  All programmes are subject to change in relation to placements order, location, speciality, length  etc    The SCOTMT website for details on Foundation training in Scotland: http://www.scotmt.scot.nhs.uk/foundation/foundation-programmes/.aspx
